result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby G Luckett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  *CORRECTED 07-18-2017*

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.   AMENDED 04-18-2018:  Vacate DNA surcharge.
Full time employment to the extent that defendant can maintain Social Security benefits.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with C.M., V.D. or T.B. without their approval and agent's approval.  Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Ct 1: 941.29(2)(a)-Felon Possess Firearm; Ct 2: 941.30(2)-2nd Degree Recklessly Endanger Safety. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co-defendant.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

ADDITIONAL CONDTIONS - DEFENDANT MUST RESIDE AT 617 MONROE AVE, RACINE, WI. DEFENDANT MAY ONLY GO TO HOSPITAL VISITS THAT ARE PREAPPROVED BY ZCI AND THAT DEFENDANT MUST CONTINUE ALL TREATMENT AS ORDERED BY MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDER.

Denying Motion to Suppress Evidence

Defendant Bobby G Luckett in court with attorney Nathan Michael Jurowski.  Defendant Bobby G Luckett in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is not going to be here for trial. The State asks that the matter be adj. Defense indicates that deft has been in custody for a long time and that is the reason that defense has filed a speedy trial demand. Defense asks that another prosecutor handle this trial. Defense asks that bond be modified. Because the prosecutor's office may not have alternate coverage Mr. Repischak will come in and do the trial. The State has an investigator assigned to investigate the alibi and the State will file a rebuttal brief. Defense MIL are granted. Defense does not oppose amendment of the information. Defense acknowleges receipt and waives reading of same; NG pleas entered. No Daubert challenges from either party. All State witnesses are available. Defense has an issue with one witness that is incarcerated in the WPS system. Anticipated length of trial is 1 day. 1 alternate, 5 strikes. State MIL are granted. The Court will give the following instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101. The State orally adds Amy Vanderhoef to his witness list. She is the Case Manager in the Clerk of Court's office. 

BTC: JT remains
